page.content: {MARTON PARISH COUNCIL-MARTON. This local council has been in existence for 91 years. It serves the area known as Marton, but not, the neighbouring village of Whitegate. The council which consists of 7 elected members and a paid parish clerk meets once every month in the Methodist Chapel Room. They are financed by a penny rate,raising about Â£600 per year.Expenditure,therefore,is low,and many schemes have to be passed on to Vale Royal District Council. The council does, however, look after roads, footpaths, vet planning applications, and nurtures its environment by planting trees and keeping its verges tidy.It looks after its inhabitants by hearing their problems each month and helping societies like the Village Recreation Room and the Old Friends Association.
